articles.description: AstraZeneca and Oxford University have given conflicting accounts of how they came upon the most effective dosing pattern for their COVID-19 vaccine, a rare instance of public dissension between major institutions collaborating on a pivotal project.
articles.content: LONDON (Reuters) - AstraZeneca and Oxford University have given conflicting accounts of how they came upon the most effective dosing pattern for their COVID-19 vaccine, a rare instance of public diss… [+7016 chars]

articles.author: Emma Reynolds, Stephanie Halasz, Frederik Pleitgen and Lindsay Isaac, CNN
articles.title: UK becomes first country to authorize Pfizer/BioNTech's Covid-19 vaccine, first shots roll out next week - CNN
articles.description: The United Kingdom has become the first Western nation to authorize a Covid-19 vaccine, a landmark moment in the coronavirus pandemic that paves the way for the first doses to be rolled out across the country next week.

articles.title: COVID-19 vaccine trial participant describes side effects - WXYZ
articles.description: According to Moderna, none of the thousands who were given two shots of the vaccine had severe COVID-19 symptoms. That is compared to 30 patients who were given a placebo who had symptoms.
